body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [stickies-v](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#issuecomment-1716769569) |
| Approach ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#pullrequestreview-1621963566) |
| Stale ACK | [ajtowns](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#issuecomment-1712717766), [theuni](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#pullrequestreview-1620037694) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/754](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/754) (Add BIP324 "Transport" label to peer details by hebasto)
* [#bitcoin-core/gui/747](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/747) (Open fully encrypted wallets by achow101)
* [#28331](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28331) (BIP324 integration by sipa)
* [#28248](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28248) (p2p: peer connection bug fixes, logic and logging improvements by jonatack)
* [#28142](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28142) (wallet: Allow users to create a wallet that encrypts all database records by achow101)
* [#28016](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28016) (p2p: gives seednode priority over dnsseed if both are provided by sr-gi)
* [#27260](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27260) (Enhanced error messages for invalid network prefix during address parsing. by russeree)
* [#26621](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26621) (refactor: Continue moving application data from CNode to Peer by dergoegge)
* [#26114](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26114) (net: Make AddrFetch connections to fixed seeds by mzumsande)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Would it make more sense to pull `MessageStartChars` alone into kernel/chainparams.h, and just add a `static_assert(sizeof(MessageStartChars) == MESSAGE_START_SIZE);` here?

Yes, that works too and I went through such an iteration. I thought adding such logic might be a bit less desirable though than just straight up moving these simple definitions and keeping the lines that are actually changed to ~0, especially since the kernel code uses definitions to both `MessageStartChars` and its size.

Ok.Approved in it...

Regards
Prince Johnso

On Thu, Sep 7, 2023, 10:55 AM Reproducibility Matters <
***@***.***> wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In src/messageheader.h
> <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1318096043>:
>
> > + * (4) message start.
> + * (12) command.
> + * (4) size.
> + * (4) checksum.
> + */
> +class CMessageHeader
> +{
> +public:
> +    static constexpr size_t MESSAGE_START_SIZE = 4;
> +    static constexpr size_t COMMAND_SIZE = 12;
> +    static constexpr size_t MESSAGE_SIZE_SIZE = 4;
> +    static constexpr size_t CHECKSUM_SIZE = 4;
> +    static constexpr size_t MESSAGE_SIZE_OFFSET = MESSAGE_START_SIZE + COMMAND_SIZE;
> +    static constexpr size_t CHECKSUM_OFFSET = MESSAGE_SIZE_OFFSET + MESSAGE_SIZE_SIZE;
> +    static constexpr size_t HEADER_SIZE = MESSAGE_START_SIZE + COMMAND_SIZE + MESSAGE_SIZE_SIZE + CHECKSUM_SIZE;
> +    typedef unsigned char MessageStartChars[MESSAGE_START_SIZE];
>
> Yes, that works too and I went through such an iteration. I thought adding
> such logic might be a bit less desirable though than just straight up
> moving these simple definitions and keeping the lines that are actually
> changed to ~0, especially since the kernel code uses definitions to both
> MessageStartChars and its size.
>
> â
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1318096043>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJTHIURGYRRLS3E6SWXSZMLXZFLDXANCNFSM6AAAAAA4N3DJPA>
> .
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.Message
> ID: ***@***.***>
>

> This removes the non-consensus critical protocol.h and netaddress.h headers from the kernel headers. 

Very nice. Concept ACK.

I guess I look at it more as "chainparams provides a 4 byte magic number" and "other things (p2p, wallet, block store) use those magic numbers to help stop you using a different chain than you intended to". That seems like a sensible thing for chainparams to do; but it's just that one line, all the other stuff in this header is p2p protocol things which don't seem interesting for the kernel?

I don't mind either way, this is a simple change. To be clear, is your intention: Move `MESSAGE_START_SIZE` and the `MessageStartChars` to `kernel/chainparams.h`, then include `kernel/chainparams.h` as needed?

I believe the two approaches work just fine together? https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/23b992e661650e87f572895ee4bad0e6e5e5196a

Edit: If you take that, please use less stupid names than I did :p
What @theuni said.

> If you take that, please use less stupid names than I did :p

Pretty sure I won't :P

Updated d4cc87f9624f38e90698f320f427204d504e4d36 -> 978baafe99bdd699940e305cd5501b4e21409ca3 ([rmNetKernel_0](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_0) -> [rmNetKernel_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_1),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/rmNetKernel_0..rmNetKernel_1))

* Addressed @ajtowns's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1317918689), moving only the required typedef and constant to the kernel includes now.
* Reverted the creation of `messageheader.h`. With the current patch I am not sure what utility this would still provide.
I think both these would make more sense in `CConnman` which is the only place that uses them; particularly if we gave it its own `CChainParams& m_params` to drop all the `Params()` calls.

Updated 978baafe99bdd699940e305cd5501b4e21409ca3 -> 197de6a98657bf1279ac22aa38cde8dc79129088 ([rmNetKernel_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_1) -> [rmNetKernel_2](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_2),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/rmNetKernel_1..rmNetKernel_2))

* Addressed @ajtowns's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1317918689), moving `GetDefaultPort` functions to `CConnman` instead.
Thanks, that makes more sense, yes.

nit: use the typedef?
```suggestion
                MessageStartMagic::MessageStartChars buf;
```

nit: Seems a bit verbose, both here and in code that uses it. Shorter would be to just use `using MessageStartMagic = std::array<uint8_t, 4>;`.

This would allow to replace `MessageStartMagic::MessageStartChars` with just `MessageStartMagic` and `MessageStartMagic::MESSAGE_START_SIZE` with just `std::tuple_size_v<MessageStartMagic>` (or a call to `obj.size()`, if an object exists)?
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,15 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2023 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#ifndef BITCOIN_KERNEL_MESSAGESTARTMAGIC_H
+#define BITCOIN_KERNEL_MESSAGESTARTMAGIC_H
+
+#include <cstddef>
+
+namespace MessageStartMagic {
+static constexpr size_t MESSAGE_START_SIZE = 4;
+typedef unsigned char MessageStartChars[MESSAGE_START_SIZE];
+} // namespace MessageStartMagic

body:
According to iwyu:

```
util/time.h should add these lines:
#include <sys/time.h>  // for timeval
#include <ctime>       // for time_t
```

Seems the only reason this compiles is because those are exported from `chrono`, which seems fragile to rely on, no?
diff_hunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,6 @@
 #ifndef BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 #define BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 
-#include <compat/compat.h>

body:
Ah yes, nice catch. `MillisToTimeval()` is the problem here. Ideally that should be moved away as `timeval` isn't api safe.

Edit: Not the highest prio though, as it's a struct and the forward-declare is fine.
diff_hunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,6 @@
 #ifndef BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 #define BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 
-#include <compat/compat.h>

body: Ah nvm. `std::time_t` is part of the public interface of `chrono`, so the include isn't needed. And the `timeval` type is fwd-declared, so this seems like a bug in iwyu.
diff_hunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,6 @@
 #ifndef BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 #define BITCOIN_UTIL_TIME_H
 
-#include <compat/compat.h>

body: Thank you for the reviews, will try to address the remaining nits.
This looks like a larger refactor to me now that I have implemented this suggestion. Is there an easy way to make `std::array<uint8_t, 4>` behave with our serialization?

body: Concept ACK.

Updated 197de6a98657bf1279ac22aa38cde8dc79129088 -> 4ce0ead928965971d082bfbe2a991703f2f5c827 ([rmNetKernel_2](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_2) -> [rmNetKernel_3](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_3),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/rmNetKernel_2..rmNetKernel_3))

* Addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1321706915), adding a commit for serializing the array as well as a commit for migrating from the raw array to the `std::array` type.
* Addressed @theuni's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#pullrequestreview-1620037694), splitting up the commit into the `m_params` member and moving the `GetDefaultPort` functions.
* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1321321923), using the `MessageStartMagic` type directly.
nit: I would be okay with dropping this and renaming the 6 places where we use `MessageStartChars`
nit: ser, that's a long line

nit: missing include, but do we need span? (+ in `sqlite.cpp`)

```suggestion
    return memcmp(Params().MessageStart().data(), app_id, 4) == 0;
```
Seemed awkward to format this line, but leave the others. I think I'll leave this as is.

Updated 4ce0ead928965971d082bfbe2a991703f2f5c827 -> d4170ca919c7f32735774d6f71ad74e04e5fcb25 ([rmNetKernel_3](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_3) -> [rmNetKernel_4](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_4),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/rmNetKernel_3..rmNetKernel_4))

* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1323265570), but took another approach by reverting back to the original name. This should keep things consistent and churn low.
* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28423#discussion_r1323294002), removing useless `Span` wrapping. I had the impression this was some minimal required sugar to get msvc to accept the type.

Rebased d4170ca919c7f32735774d6f71ad74e04e5fcb25 -> d5067651991f3e6daf456ba13c7036ddc4545352 ([rmNetKernel_4](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_4) -> [rmNetKernel_5](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/rmNetKernel_5),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/rmNetKernel_4..rmNetKernel_5))

* Fixed silent merge conflict with #28196
re-ACK d506765
